title: (x) "The Art of Richard Tuttle" by Madeleine Grynszetejn - FF Scala {Stephen}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015713im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/bodytext_5350.jpg)

Would appreciate if anyone could identify this font for my girlfriend. She’s in the process of doing a publication for a photographic journal. Are there any fonts worth recommending her? Serif ones.

Many regards to everyone.

 [‹ Chalet font - anything the same or very similar?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015713/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20214 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) soft slab serif "Pojects" - Italia {Kate McDonnell} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015713/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20208 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Hinching Chan

comments.content:
She needs something contemporary. She likes Fedra Serif. But cheaper. And plans to pair it up with DIN.

It’s actually for an artsy exhibition publication instead of a photographic journal.

[FF Scala](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015713/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=6&displayfontid=FF.11569.0.0&fontRendererText=dance+work+Project). Highly recommended, and will do well with FF DIN.
Plus now it’s available as feature-rich OpenType font! :^)
